The following statements are correct:

I. Excessive clearance between the valve stem and valve guide will lead to valve sticking as carbon accumulates between them.
II. A defective valve cotter will lead to a valve drop issue.
III. If the cylinder head gasket and O’ ring seating areas have any scratches, uneven wear, or dent marks, it will lead to exhaust gas and water leaking between the cylinder head and cylinder liner.

The following statements are correct:

I. If the piston ring groove is worn down, blow-by gas will increase, lube oil consumption will be high, and it will lead to piston ring breakage.
II. If the defric coating of the piston skirt is worn in long-term operation, there will be more friction resistance between the piston and the liner, which will lead to the piston getting stuck.
III. If the ring groove clearance is excessive or there is peeling of the ring groove chrome plating, it will lead to gas cutting on piston ring land areas and also onto the liner surface.

The following statements are correct:

I. If the rotary valve coupling is worn out, the opening and closing timing of the starting valve will be delayed, making the starting difficult.
II. If the rotary valve and rotary valve seat wear excessively, a gap will appear between the rotary valve and valve seat, and as a consequence, starting air will pass through all units at the same time when starting the engine, making it unable to rotate.
III. If the clearance between the bush and the rotary valve shaft diameter is excessive, lubricating oil will enter the starting air pipeline, making it difficult to start the engine.

The principal functions of lubricating oil are
options: to maintain the required temperature of the engine, lubricating oil, and intake air.
to get higher engine efficiency and to take the designated load.
to generate the thermal energy of the diesel engine and to maintain better conditions and performance of the fuel injection pump.
to reduce the friction resistance of moving parts and minimize the wear effect of engine components.
answer: to reduce the friction resistance of moving parts and minimize the wear effect of engine components.

If the LO analysis data shows that the following materials are out of the standard limit, you may check the parts as shown below. Which numbers are correct?

I. Chrome (Cr) — Piston ring groove, piston ring
II. Aluminium (Al) — Crankpin bearing, main bearing
III. Copper (Cu), Tin (Sn), Zinc (Zn) — Bush bearing
IV. Iron (Fe) — Bush bearing, gear, needle bearing, piston, liner
V. Calcium (Ca), Sodium (Na) — Water contamination
VI. Vanadium (V) — Fuel oil contamination
options: I, II, III, IV, V, VI
answer: I, II, III, IV, V, VI

I. If you observe that more than 50% of the defric coating on the piston skirt is worn down, reconditioning the piston is recommended.

The maker’s recommends carrying out a retightening check of con-rod bolts (hydraulic tightening) is
options: within 500 running hours after maintenance/initial and then followed by every 2,000-3,000 running hours of continuous operation.
within 2,000-3,000 running hours after maintenance/initial and then followed by every 4,000-6,000 running hours of continuous operation.
within 300-500 running hours after maintenance/initial and then followed by every 1,000-1,500 running hours continuous operation.
answer: within 2,000-3,000 running hours after maintenance/initial and then followed by every 4,000-6,000 running hours of continuous operation.

Which statement is correct?
options: The higher the cetane number of diesel oil, the more quickly ignite and lead more complete combustion.
The higher the cetane number of diesel oil, the more quickly ignite and lead less complete combustion.
The lower the cetane number of diesel oil, the more quickly ignite and lead more complete combustion.

answer: The higher the cetane number of diesel oil, the more quickly ignite and lead more complete combustion.
